analysis: The documents all pertain to the establishment, continuation, or modification of presidential committees, councils, or commissions. These entities are created to advise the President on various issues, conduct reviews, develop recommendations, and coordinate efforts across different government agencies and sectors. The topics covered range from fund-raising within the federal service, pension policies, entitlement reform, rural poverty, natural beauty and recreation, water resources, and digital television broadcasting to veterans' illnesses. Many of these committees are established under the Federal Advisory Committee Act.
title: Presidential Advisory Groups: Formation, Function, and Extension
